html:
Station 4 Opens in Southwest

Southwest, that area along the Anacostia waterfront, home to the just redone Arena Stage and the reopened Fourth Street, just scored a breakthrough on its way to being rebuilt. Station 4, a new bar, restaurant, had its successful grand opening last week.

It's all about the music, Hun

Attila may have been one of history’s fiercest warriors, but he’s no match, according to Giuseppe Verdi, for one woman’s sworn revenge. John Relyea, who proved to be as s

Crazed cab crashes along P Street

An out-of-control cab careened down P Street, hitting a pick-up truck, knocking over a city tree, and landing on a brick retaining wall, inches from a townhouse. The incident happened just before 1:00

A student's perspective in Georgetown

My name is Mike Meaney and I am the President of the Georgetown University Student Association (GUSA). I’m excited to be a regular columnist for The Georgetown Dish this year.

GBA Networking with a view at House of Sweden August 17

Join the GBA for Networking with a View...And a Salute to Furin's

Wednesday, August 17, 2011| 6:30 – 8:30 p.m.

House of Sweden| On the Waterfront | 2900 K Street NW | Georgetown

Toyota burns on K Street, causing snarl

On Friday night a Toyota caught fire near K Street and 27th NW just before 6:00 pm at the height of the evening rush hour. The D.C. Fire Department arrived a few minutes later and quickly extinguished the flames. No one was hurt. By 6:30 D.C.

Adieu frizzies, bon jour O Salon

If you’ve been going to O Salon, you already love your hair. You know that owners, Guillaume Choquet and Soner Ozbay share a vision, that great hair is more than a precision cut and fabulous styling.

Summer tastes of Spain at Social Safeway

Georgetown's “Social Safeway” spices up the dog days of summer Thursday, Aug. 11 from 6:00 to 8:00 pm with a special sangria and Spanish wine tasting with Juan Jimenez of Mio restaurant. The summertime event will take place at the store’s wine bar and is open to the public.

Cheers to Morton's summer cocktails

Five deliciously skinny cocktails debuted Thursday at Morton’s, attracting a spirited crowd to the patio, where Georgetowners sampled the 200 calorie "Spa-tini's" on a refreshingly cool summer evening.

Chez Huntley - update 08/05

A great deal of progress has been made here in the past couple of weeks. The millwork installation – new casing, baseboards and bookshelves – is complete. The painting has been corrected and looks lovely.

Love me or leaf me

Surely it has not escaped any Georgetowner that we have just survived the hottest July on record.

The American Songbook Sunday on 89.3 FM

Every Sunday, a national treasure gets behind the microphone at WPFW 89.3 FM to broadcast selections from "The American Songbook." For two hours, Frank Sinatra, Ella Fitzgerald, Sarah Vaughn and others sing some of the most beautiful tunes ever written.

Protesters target Trader Joe's tomatoes

It's been called an aphrodisiac (the "love apple" in French) and an anti-oxidant cancer fighter. But now, the tomato is also causing protests across America, involving native Americans, accusations of slavery, and basic human rights.

Food Network looks for stars in D.C.

Design Star, HGTV’s top-rated reality competition series and Food Network Star, Food Network’s hugely successful culinary reality series, are casting for Seasons 7 and 8, holding open casting calls in Washington August 8 and 9, 10:00 am to 2:00 pm at The Westin

Meat market Wednesday at Rose Park

“What the f---is he waiting for? Sorry, buddy. You can aim, but at some point you have to pull the trigger.” Jamie Stachowski was not talking about hunting. Without pausing, “If Hillary was in there, she wouldn’t have let this happen.”

Breaktime From Dresses

Jumpsuits are one of my favorites pieces of comfy-chic clothing that provide a nice break from wearing one more dress. They're an easy option for those nights you're not feeling inspired to put together an outfit - just throw on a jumpsuit, accessorize and voila, you're set!

City expands bike-sharing program

By Brady Holt...Current Staff Writer...

As Georgetown residents expressed satisfaction with a new Capital Bikeshare station the city plans to open this fall at M Street and Pennsylvania Avenue, officials said even further expansion of the bicycle program is likely within a year.

Marissa's bucket list

A few days ago I received an email from my friend Marissa Rauch. She’d just finished “Bike to the Beach,” a 108-mile ride from D.C. to Dewey Beach, Delaware, benefiting Autism Speaks. Marissa, a celebrated photographer, biked in honor of Camille Galli, a friend’s daughter who has autism.

Meet the maestro of meat at Rose Park Wednesday

With aliases like 'The Maestro of Meat,' 'The Butcher from Buffalo,' 'Captain of Carpacchio,' and 'The Crown Prince of Poultry', Jamie Stachowski is definitely a man for all meats.

Cheh speaks softly but surely against Dan Snyder's suit

Councilmember Mary Cheh has signed on to an amicus brief filed by the ACLU and 14 media and public interest organizations countering Redskins owner Dan

Get the spa-tini treatment at Morton’s Thursday

Cool off on Morton’s Georgetown patio Thursday evening, August 4 from 6:30 to 8:00 pm. Enjoy complimentary hors d'oeuvres, great company and get the skinny on their new under 200 calorie cocktails.

Mayor announces parking ticket amnesty

Mayor Vincent Gray has announced an amnesty period on parking and other motor vehicles which started Monday.

Herb Miller travels to party for Ward 4 Councilmember

Developer Herb Miller left Georgetown last week to go all the way to a fundraiser birthday party for Councilmember Muriel Bowser in Ward 4, the top corner of the District, including neighborhoods like Shepherd Park, Takoma, Crestwood and Petworth. Why the special effort?

Primi Piatti, where Italians dine with pleasure

A charming European retreat in the heart of the nation’s capital, Primi Piatti boasts some of the most authentic Italian cuisine the city has to offer.

See Todd Reed’s diamonds in the rough today at I. Gorman

“The first cut is the deepest.” Of course, Rod Stewart was singing about love. When it comes to raw diamonds, Todd Reed, internationally acclaimed jewelry designer believes the most perfect cut is no cut at all.

House fire stopped by Georgetown teen

The East Village was buzzing with fire trucks and emergency vehicles Wednesday after smoke and a D.C. government email alert warned the entire city of a fire emergency in the 2700 block of P Street.
Returning to Marvin Gaye's old stomping grounds

Puppy Love

Some of you will understand this and some of you won’t. But I am totally and completely in love with my dog. Nina, my Norwegian Elkhound, is the love of my life.

Clyde’s Willow Creek Farm part two: the inn

Farm-to-Fork, the Loudon County celebration of locally grown food and wine, was well underway when I visited Clyde’s Willow Creek Farm. Here, the distance from farm to fork is a mere ten minute walk up the hill behind

Heat moves up trash collection

The D.C. Department of Public Works announced today that its trash and recycling crews will begin their collections an hour earlier at 6:00 am through the week of August 1 due to predicted 90° and above temperatures.

P Street Pictures could face final 15 minutes of frame

She has survived prolonged recessions, floods and blizzards, crime waves, upturns and downturns. She has kept the doors of her neighborhood-oriented business open on P Street for 28 years in Georgetown, supporting two co-workers for 25 years.

Open space, no wood s'il vous plait

When you find a Bulthaup kitchen, an Alessi toilet not available in the U.S., a Waterworks bathtub, an Italian bathroom sink that drains from behind the basin, and walls covered in Calcutta marble, you must ask: Who lives here?

A Penny For Your Thoughts...or Shoes

Are your pennies ready?! This Fall, penny loafers are a must-have for your feet!

We all scream for...Leslie's ice cream picks

With the dog days of summer officially stalled over Washington (as well as the rest of the country for a change), relaxing in the shade with a cold drink seems the only practical way to persevere. Unless you are an ice cream fanatic like me.

Flash mob robs Victoria's Secret in Georgetown mall

Police detectives are investigating a theft at a Victoria’s Secret store Monday afternoon located inside the Shops at Georgetown Park, Fox 5 reported.

Homeless center reopens after extensive renovation

By Jackie Zubrzycki...Current Correspondent...

Georgetown U. student brings passion to politics

On a 100+ degree day during a long summer, you couldn't blame a college student for taking a day off. But Georgetown University rising senior Mike Meaney is on a call with the President -- President Obama, that is -- about the debt ceiling.

Clyde’s Willow Creek Farm part one: the farm

“Best office I’ve ever worked in” proclaimed Tim MacLean, as we meandered around the Celeste fig trees, past the Deerfield purple garlic, Mexican sour gherkins, rhubarb and artichoke bushes, tasting Killarney raspberries, chocolate mint and lemon basil along the way.

Calling qualified candidates to run for D.C. Attorney General!

The Thomas Mess, now playing

Expanding D.C.'s roots globally

What's in your Dish? Down Dog Yoga's Patty Ivey asks...

Remember when you were five years old and life seemed so magical? Every day was filled with a sense of wonder.

A time when you believed that anything was possible.

Free Pinkberry frozen yogurt today in Georgetown

From 5:00-6:00 pm today, Monday July 25, Pinkberry, the California tart frozen yogurt brand is giving away free yogurt at their soon-to-be open Georgetown location at 3288 M Street.

Yes, that's across the street from Georgetown Cupcake.

Chuck Thies' spicy politics dish served here

Radio host and veteran D.C. politics advisor Chuck Thies will contribute a regular column to The Georgetown Dish beginning this week. Thies is co-host of WPFW's "D.C. Politics" airing Thursdays at 11:00 am on 89.3 FM.
Blasts from the past come to a city needing cool

Hank

With the AC blasting in my car this morning, I venture out to Starbucks on Wisconsin Avenue for my usual venti latte. On the way, I call a friend, complaining of the stifling heat as I drive through the leafy streets of Georgetown.

Lou Lou offers sparkling bargains

Lou Lou Boutique, a family-owned jewelry business based in Middleburg, was cooking this weekend as locals and tourists alike ducked out of the sun to browse a wide range of sparkling jewelry, accessories and handbags next to The Georgetown Inn.

Georgetown students dive into debt debate

The Georgetown University Student Association led by President Mike Meaney has sent a letter to President Obama imploring him and other leaders to reach a compromise on the debt ceiling debate and the country’s budget crisis,

Tom's hot dome

Did you hear? The hot dome is coming. The excessive heat that remained relatively contained in the nation's mid-section is spilling into Georgetown....

Photos by Tom Quiggle

Chez Huntley - update 7/22

One step forward, one step back. We had a major hiccup this week at chez Huntley. Remember all those beautiful neutrals I taped to my walls? Remember that I selected Benjamin Moore’s Vanilla Milkshake as one of my colors? That turned out to be a bit of a problem.
